alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, southwestern Braxton, southeastern Roane and Clay Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glen, or 8 miles west of Clay, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clay, Clendenin, Glen, Big Otter, Wallback, Amma, Harrison, Nebo, Bickmore, Procious, Servia, Indore, Left Hand, Ivydale and Strange Creek. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 19 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
